summary:
With 20 years experience in the Digital industry, I am an Awesomologist™ and a Digital Leader.

I believe in an Agile mindset: fail fast/learn faster. I always support the idea of attempting something ambitious and if it fails, learning from it and adapting. Failure isn’t a negative, it is a learning oppourtunity.

I am a leader who believes that business objectives and ROIs are a priority, but they are not the only priority. I lead teams the way I want to be led: with common goals in mind, with common sense and with humanity. Team members are humans first, employees second. I am a coach and a cheerleader for any team I lead and believe that I must give the team the best chances to advance their skills and their career. When they succeed, we all do.

I have an ability to bring people together, to foster a community, to create alignment and consensus to help everyone move forward together. I am a firm believer in building quality, real relationships to achieve business goals together.

Love what you do and surround yourself with amazing people. It's unreal what you'll learn.

profile_positions.description:
- part of the new digital transformation that is changing how IKEA approaches its customers
- strategic decisions as a Member of management forums
- responsible for planning Digital activities and accountable for achieving excellent results in the country
- local business partner responsible for Digital, while working as a seamless part of the global Digital organization
- full responsibility for the Digital Agenda within The Netherlands and led the Digital transformation in countries to ensure that Digital capabilities are fully leveraged
- ensured high quality technical support provided to support business operations in the country
- ensured product deployments are executed with excellence
- overall responsibility to ensure information security and compliance is incorporated in all parts of the country Digital unit operations
- represented the country as a spokesperson and external representative for all entities within Digital in the country
profile_positions.title: Chief Digital Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Owned Canada Digital Roadmap, an amalgamation of Group Digital and IKEA Canada Project Launches
• Facilitated the Canada Digital Forum, to create awareness, se t priorities and ensure quality project launches within Canada, by establishing a cross-functional team of Managers in the Forum
• Lead implementation of all digital launches in Canada
• Ensure that product rollouts run according to plan, based on detailed digital roadmap plans received from roadmap teams
• Facilitate flow of roadmap and launch feedback from countries to roadmap teams, through the creation of an environment of sharing and encouraging other countries to reach out to the IKEA Canada Deployment Team
• Lead monthly DPDL bi-monthly meetings, contributing to the creation of a global community of DPDL leaders
• Supported and contributed to the “JIRA Improvement Forum”, establishing JIRA as a singular digital tool within Digital Countries and raising the base of knowledge within the DPDL community
• Ensure proper multifunctional staffing for successful launches in Canada
• Work across initiatives within Ingka Group, steering a successful digital product deployment that drives IKEA business results
• Ensure rapid adoption of new products within Canada through an exponential rollout plan with contribution from assembled cross-functional support teams
• Secure that Canadian cross-functional support teams organize for deployment in close collaboration with global deployment support teams, in terms of people and tools
• Ensure implementation of change management activities with Digital Project Leader & Canada Digital Team
• Successfully drive the adoption of products, including communications, training, and stakeholder management
profile_positions.title: Country Digital Portfolio and Deployment Leader

profile_positions.description:
- part of the new digital transformation that is changing how IKEA approaches its customers

- established Digital as a new team within IKEA Canada, contributing to the business and growth of the organization
- key strategic decisions as a Member of management forums

achieving excellent results in the country

- ensured product deployments are executed with excellence
- overall responsibility to ensure information security and compliance is incorporated in
all parts of the country Digital unit operations
- represented the country as a spokesperson and external representative for all entities
within Digital in the country
profile_positions.title: Country Digital Manager / Chief Digital Officer (Acting)

profile_positions.description:
- Led team of developers to enhance and grow the IKEA Canada website through local developments and launches related to internal digital priorities
- Research, develop and implement new ways of working (e.g. Amazon Web Services, Agile / Kanban)
- Worked closely with web editors, web and mobile specialists, to ensure a high-quality front-end design is achieved for projects
- Support global deployments and initiatives (e.g. responsive website launch)
profile_positions.title: Web Technology Specialist, Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Take The Leap Photography is a family, newborn, engagement and wedding photographer. Take The Leap also does portrait, birthday and cake-smash photography.

Formerly Take The Leap Designs, the company began in web design and web development, based out of Hamilton, Ontario, Canada.

• CodeCanyon-approved Wordpress plugin author (GolfDeputy)
• photographer for local families, maternity and newborns, weddings and other digital photography
• acted as a project manager for local clients looking to build websites or a brand for their business
• built websites for local clients, using WordPress, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
• design and create branding materials (logo design, print design and business cards)
profile_positions.title: Owner/Awesomologist™

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed a variety of clients, including President's Choice Financial, Yamaha, The Mobile Shop, Voortman and other clients as assigned
•	Actively participated in creative brainstorming
•	Facilitated all communications and interactions with the client, 3rd party vendors, media buyers and internal stakeholders
•	Responsible for Quality Assurance testing support for all program launches
•	Managed a variety of projects at any given time from smaller maintenance updates to large product launches, contests, digital media buys and promotional materials
•	Provided copywriting support for various programs
•	Created and managed timelines and budgets for all projects
•	Fostered effective relationships with internal team members, external clients, and 3rd party vendors to successfully deliver projects on time and within budget
•	Actively involved in planning internal Thrillworks activities and team building events
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Acting as a lead on front-end development projects
• Participating in brainstorming to continually improve the interaction design of front-end interfaces
• Scrum Master for AGILE teams
• Help define front-end coding standards and practices to improve reliability and efficiency
• Working closely with strategy, design, project management and production teams to create exceptional user experiences
• Quoting and defining front-end project work
profile_positions.title: Senior Front End Developer

profile_positions.description:
LastWordOnSports is an opinion-based site with over 100 active writers, and over 250K unique pageviews per month.

As CTO, my roles and responsibilities:
• maintain the website integrity as a whole: built on WordPress, the site requires constant monitoring, updates, ensure stability, etc.
• be team lead for all technical issues, developments and projects
• train the ever-expanding staff of writers, departments and senior executives on web-based technologies, including but not limited to: WordPress, Google Analytics, SoundCloud and web best practices
• provide direction and strategy for LWOS as a Senior Manager and Executive
• introduce and test new web-based technologies to ensure a good workflow for all staff
profile_positions.title: Chief Technology Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Participated in major website design project
• Developed high quality code that adhered to corporate standards
• Developed new features, fixed defects
• Detailed test case development and rigorous unit testing of all development work
• Participated in design/architecture reviews
profile_positions.title: Senior Web Developer (Contract)

profile_positions.description:
• front-end developer for the AGILE team that developed the redesigned "Green News Radio" (e.g. 680 News) websites
• developed Wordpress-driven site, using PHP, SQL, jQuery, AJAX
• part of a true AGILE team, participating in daily scrums, sprints, sprint reviews and design reviews.
• collaborated with other senior developers and provided guidance, leadership and teaching sessions to junior developers and co-op students
profile_positions.title: Senior Web Developer (Contract)

profile_positions.description:
• supported the largest number (4) of regional CBC websites across Canada (Hamilton, Kitchener-Waterloo, Thunder Bay and Sudbury) and was only one of three developers with more than one regional responsibility
• designed and developed four elements (infographics, interactive presentations or microsites) per week for regional web pages, exceeding set goal of three per week
• transitioned Sudbury and Thunder Bay regional sites to the latest CBC website template after being on the previous template for three years
• maintained “Local Service Extension” websites in Hamilton and Kitchener-Waterloo, using a full development cycle (Dev, QA, PROD) and SVN repositories
• trained local reporting and production staff in each region to use online tools to enhance storytelling and increase effective reach of stories, microsites and interactives
• trained local reporting and production staff to use multiple CMS and templating systems: Polopoly, MPX, EPT, ExpressionEngine
• required skills included use/knowledge of: HTML5/CSS3, Responsive Design, jQuery, YUI, SVN, XML, mobile web development, Asynchronous JavaScript


Recommendations from colleagues without LinkedIn:
"While running CBC's Hamilton bureau in 2013, I had the privilege of working alongside Kevin Gamble. He has a sharp eye for detail and design, knows his code, he's fast and can effectively juggle multiple tasks, and he's a creative troubleshooter. Besides his professional competence, Kevin has a great sense of humour - he's one of those people who helps bring an office together and who can cleverly defuse even the most stressful situations. In short, Kevin is a total team player, a real technical and design talent, and one of those people you really want backing you up when something hits the fan."
- Ian Johnson, Senior Producer, CBCNews.ca
profile_positions.title: Regional Web Developer (Contract)

profile_positions.description:
▪ created bleeding-edge (at the time) web design and development, including but not limited to HTML5, CSS3, Responsive Design, CoffeeScript, CoffeeKup; all were self-taught
▪ designed and implemented creative and effective web user interfaces for public facing web sites, mobile web applications, and administrative web tools
▪ worked within a small, Agile-driven development team to create, produce and distribute prototype applications, meant to be a “proof of concept” for expansion into other areas of PostMedia
profile_positions.title: Web Developer

profile_positions.description:
• sat on Hiring Board for new Designers within the Interactive Services department
• trained, evaluated and provided feedback to three new Junior Web and Mobile Designer hires
• created and enforced new and existing Design department policies, templates and workflow
• designed and coded front-end, public-facing website content
• developed trusted relationships with Sales representatives; I was invited to pitch meetings as a trusted representative to their potential business
• integrated the graphic design of a product with back-end functionality by slicing designs from Photoshop and coding in HTML, CSS, JS and PHP
• design and build rich-media advertisements: banner ads, sponsorship pages, and full-day takeovers
• ensured the accurate tracking of web statistics through client side scripting and Omniture
profile_positions.title: Web Designer

profile_positions.description:
▪ campaign setup, enter creative ads and monitor campaigns on TWN web properties
▪ create, revise and monitor campaigns as per sales contracts and optimal performance standards
▪ troubleshoot at various stages to ensure expectant delivery of campaign
profile_positions.title: Web Traffic Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
▪ Flash design/development: ad creation, programming, serving and launch
▪ work extensively within the ASP, XML and .NET environments
▪ development and continue progress of the flagship proprietary technology
▪ manage a team of three developers to create ads with flagship technology
profile_positions.title: Designer

volunteer_experiences.description:
Mohawk 3 Pitch Organization (M3PO) is a 3-pitch (slopitch) league run out of Hamilton, Ontario. It is a “fun first” league (it’s literally Rule #1), with skill levels ranging from beginner to seasoned veteran. The league aims to create a community of softball and slo-pitch players that play for the love of the game, rather than shiny trophies. It's probably the best 3-pitch league in Hamilton and certainly the funnest. Yes, "funnest".

http://mohawk3pitch.com

An annual charity golf tournament, in support of a fantastic local charity and hospital that, in a daily basis, performs feats that are nothing short of miracles. 

Fore Mac is run in support of the McMaster Children’s Hospital Foundation. 

http://foremac.com

Gourley Park 3 Pitch Incorporated is run out of Gourley Park in Hamilton, ON. Located on the west mountain, the league has been around for over 25 years and quite honestly, it’s awesome. Gourley Park 3 Pitch aims to provide the best 3 Pitch experience in the Hamilton area, while creating a community of slo-pitch players and improving the quality of life through leisure activities for the community as a whole.

As one of two Directors, my responsibilities include maintaining the website (http://gp3p.ca), schedule creation, treasurer, tournament direction and operation, banquet direction and setup, and to maintain the general good-natured attitude of the league and brand.
